meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>grip</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to grasp</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: You go <vocabulary>to grasp</vocabulary> someone. You really need them. You are soooo <reading>needy</reading> (にぎ). Except, you can't really pronounce "d" sounds very well, so you say にぎ.
